text: GUESS, said the voice, in the tones of one slightly out of her depth, "I don't have to tell a teacher everything."

passages.full_quote: Fair enough, <used>said the voice, I</used> was only trying to help

passages.fragment: said the voice , in the tones of one
passages.full_quote: <used>said the voice, in the tones of one</used> who indeed does know it, and is not the one standing in it

passages.fragment: , in the tones of one slightly out of her depth , `` I do
passages.full_quote: Vimes couldn't tell the daughters one from the other, except the one called Emily, who certainly lodged in the mind and possibly also in doorways, and who now said, <used>in the tones of one slightly out of her depth, "I do beg yo</used>ur pardon, commander, but I don't think we understand what you just vouchsafed?"
"Er," he be<used>gan, "I don't have to</used> die to get the job, do I?"

passages.fragment: `` I do n't have to tell
passages.full_quote: "<used>I don't have to tell</used> you what'll happen if the Archchancellor hears that his staff has been seen at the common entertainments."

passages.fragment: n't have to tell a teacher everything
passages.full_quote: You did<used>n't have to tell a teacher everything</used>
